result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marleik Cornell Brown-Jewell

Defendant Marleik Cornell Brown-Jewell appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Joel H. Rosenthal not in court.  Attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm 
Case calendared for Bail/Bond Hearing this date.  Attorney Rosenthal did not appear.  Defendant was on Zoom, however, Court advised he wouldn't be needed.  Attorney Rosenthal contacted.  Court adjourns matter to date of trial.  Case adjourned for Jury Trial November 14, 2022 at 9:00 am
At defense request and no objection from the state, case scheduled for bail hearing on 11-01-2022 at 1:30 pm, Branch 15
Notice of Motion and Motion to Modify Bail, filed

Defendant Marleik Cornell Brown-Jewell not in court, in custody.  Attorney Joel H. Rosenthal in court for Marleik Cornell Brown-Jewell.  Attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 
Final pretrial held. Case remains in trial posture. Jury trial scheduled for 11-14-2022 at 9:00 am, Branch 15.

Attorney Joel H. Rosenthal in court, defendant Marleik Cornell Brown-Jewell not in court, in custody.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means.
CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO COURT REPORTER AVAILABILITY.
Case heard by ZOOM.
Case in court for status conference. Defendant has pending matter 21CM1414 in Branch 15. Case is in trial posture, defense counsel requests case be placed on the trial calendar.  
Any pretrial motions to be filed by the final pretrial date. Case adjourned to Branch 15.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Court orders case bail reduced to $500.00 cash.  All other conditions of bail to remain.

Attorney Joel H. Rosenthal in court, defendant Marleik Cornell Brown-Jewell not in court, in custody.  Karen Lynch Vespalec appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Defense bail motion heard.  Arguments placed on the record.  Court orders case bail reduced to $500.00 cash.  All other conditions of bail to remain.  Case adjourned, Br. 15.  Status conference scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADJOURNED OFF THE RECORD.  Case calendared for a Status Conference on 7-29-2022.
Due to the Judicial Rotation court orderd matter adjourned. New date selected with defense counsel via email./
Effective  July 30, 2022  this calendar will be assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15  in Room 623 of the Courthouse.
Defense to notify his client of the new date and time. This hearing will be held in person.
Plea and Sentencing scheduled August 2, 2022 at 8:30am

Attorney Joel H. Rosenthal in court, defendant Marleik Cornell Brown-Jewell not in court, in custody.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case in court for a Pretrial Conference.
Defense in receipt of discovery r and request a bailbond hearing. Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on July 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Case in court for a Bailbond Hearing. Defendant in custody. No counsel has been appointe to the case. 
Court ordered matter adjourned for a pretrial conference to be heard alongside defendant pending matter 21CM1414.
Case remains calendared in  Branch 19. This hearing will be be held streamed Live through dacast- via Zoom.
Pretrial Conference scheduled July 6, 2022 at 8:30am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Marleik Cornell Brown-Jewell in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Defendant Marleik Cornell Brown-Jewell in custody.  Karen Lynch Vespalec appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Marleik Cornell Brown-Jewell appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant has lower number case(s) pending.  Defendant is advised this case is reassigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned to Br. 19 for pretrial.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
